content:
Excited to announce NotContosso's new AI Collaboration Suite! After 18 months of building with our customers, we're launching a platform that fundamentally changes how teams work together.

Here's what makes it different:

- Real-time AI meeting insights (not just transcription â€” actual actionable summaries)
- Document co-creation where AI understands your team's context
- Workflow automation that learns from your patterns

The result? Our beta customers saw 40% fewer meetings and 3x faster document turnaround.

AI that works with you, not instead of you. That's been our north star from day one.

What's the biggest collaboration challenge your team faces? Drop it in the comments â€” we might already have a solution.

#NotContosso #AIInnovation #EnterpriseAI #FutureOfWork #AICollaboration

Just shipped AI Collaboration Suite v3.0

New features:

Our beta users: 40% fewer meetings, 3x faster docs.

The future of work isn't about replacing people. It's about amplifying them.

#NotContosso #AI #BuildInPublic

These 12 engineers spent 18 months obsessing over one question: How do you make AI feel like a teammate, not a tool?

#NotContosso #AIInnovation #TechLife #TeamNotContosso #BTS #StartupLife #AICompany #LaunchDay #TechTeam #BuildInPublic #FutureOfWork #EnterpriseAI #AI #Innovation #TeamWork

The biggest myth in enterprise AI?

That it replaces people.

After working with 200+ enterprise teams, here's what we actually see:

1. AI handles the repetitive work â†’ humans get creative time back
2. AI surfaces insights â†’ humans make better decisions
3. AI automates workflows â†’ humans focus on strategy

The companies winning with AI aren't replacing their teams. They're amplifying them.

Our data across 200 enterprise deployments:
- 35% increase in strategic work time
- 50% reduction in administrative tasks
- 28% improvement in team satisfaction scores

The future belongs to human + AI teams. Not AI alone.

What's your experience? Is AI replacing work at your org, or amplifying it?

#NotContosso #AIInnovation #EnterpriseAI #FutureOfWork #DigitalTransformation #TechLeadership

Hot take: The best AI product is the one your team actually uses.

We spent 6 months with zero new features, just watching how teams interact with our AI.

Result: Usage went up 60% when we simplified the UX.

Stop building features. Start removing friction.

#AI #NotContosso #DevCommunity

We just completed our first enterprise deployment in healthcare.

I'm not going to lie â€” it was hard.

Compliance requirements we'd never seen. Data residency constraints. Clinician workflows that can't be interrupted.

But here's what we learned:

âœ… Start with the workflow, not the technology
âœ… Compliance isn't a blocker â€” it's a design constraint
âœ… Clinicians don't want AI tools â€” they want fewer clicks

The result: 45% reduction in clinical documentation time. Zero compliance incidents.

Healthcare AI isn't about replacing doctors. It's about giving them more time to be doctors.

We're hiring healthcare AI specialists. DM me if you want to help build the future of clinical AI.

#NotContosso #AIInnovation #HealthcareAI #EnterpriseAI #DigitalTransformation

Thread: 5 things I wish I knew before building an AI company ðŸ§µ

1/ Your first 10 customers will teach you more than your entire pitch deck.

We pivoted 3 times in year one because what enterprises SAY they want and what they ACTUALLY use are wildly different.

2/ Hiring ML engineers is table stakes. Hiring people who understand the DOMAIN is the real moat.

Our best product decisions came from team members who worked in the industries we serve.

3/ AI demos are easy. AI in production is brutal.

Latency, edge cases, hallucinations, scale â€” the gap between demo and production is where most AI startups die.

4/ Enterprise sales cycles are long, but enterprise retention is forever.

Our first enterprise customer is still our biggest champion 3 years later.

5/ The most important metric isn't accuracy â€” it's adoption.

A 95% accurate model that nobody uses is worth less than an 85% accurate model embedded in the workflow.

What would you add? ðŸ‘‡

#NotContosso #AI #BuildInPublic #Startups

POV: You're an AI engineer and your model just passed all production tests on the first try ðŸ¤¯

(Spoiler: This has never actually happened to anyone in the history of ML)

But seriously â€” our QA team's reaction when our healthcare AI module passed compliance testing was PRICELESS. Swipe for the full story â†’

Frame 1: The nervous refresh
Frame 2: The green checkmarks appearing one by one
Frame 3: The team erupting
Frame 4: The celebratory pizza

This is what building AI that actually matters looks like. Not just algorithms and data â€” but teams who care deeply about getting it right.

We're growing! Link in bio for open roles.
